title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. E, pt. 1290 - World Trade Center
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. E, pt. 1290 - World Trade Center

State Regulations
§ 1290.1 - Permission granted to use World Trade Center conditional
§ 1290.2 - Entry restrictions
§ 1290.3 - Authorization required for commercial activity, entertainment or solicitation of funds
§ 1290.4 - Permission required for posting or distribution of printed matter, etc
§ 1290.5 - Lost articles to be turned over to Port Authority
§ 1290.6 - Animals and pets, barred; exception
§ 1290.7 - Requests for Port Authority employees to perform work or services to be directed to manager
§ 1290.8 - Smoking, operation of cutting torches and like devices restricted
§ 1290.9 - Transportation, storage, etc. of certain materials and substances prohibited
§ 1290.10 - Tampering with controls, equipment, etc. prohibited
§ 1290.11 - Overloading of utility, mechanical, etc. systems prohibited
§ 1290.12 - Obstruction of expansion or contraction joints prohibited
§ 1290.13 - Permission required for installations or operation of certain equipment
§ 1290.14 - Permission required to lay floor covering
§ 1290.15 - Locks and keys
§ 1290.16 - Obstruction light, air, heat, etc. passage prohibited
§ 1290.17 - Approval required for certain service contracts
§ 1290.18 - Measures required to eliminate damaging vibrations
§ 1290.19 - Objectionable noise prohibited
§ 1290.20 - Acts or omissions resulting in filing of liens prohibited
§ 1290.21 - Names of persons to be notified in event of emergency to be filed
§ 1290.22 - Doors, windows to be locked and utility services turned off upon leaving
§ 1290.23 - Use of premises for lodging, sleeping or immoral purposes prohibited
§ 1290.24 - Use of premises during other than normal business hours
§ 1290.25 - Sidewalks, open areas, etc. to be kept free from snow, ice, dirt and rubbish
§ 1290.26 - Accumulation and disposal of garbage, debris, waste, etc. restricted
§ 1290.27 - Movement of inventory, supplies, equipment, furnishings, etc. restricted
§ 1290.28 - Right reserved to inspect freight, articles, packages, etc. brought in or out
§ 1290.29 - Elevator service
§ 1290.30 - Operation of elevators by persons other than Port Authority employees prohibited
§ 1290.31 - Vehicular traffic restricted
§ 1290.32 - Disabled, abandoned or illegally parked vehicles subject to removal
§ 1290.33 - Operation of motor vehicles
§ 1290.34 - Duty of driver of vehicle involved in accidents
§ 1290.35 - Definitions

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. E, pt. 1290

Statutory authority: N.Y. Laws 1921, ch. 154, art. VI and
N.J. Laws 1921, ch. 151, consented to by Congress 42 U.S. Stat. 174 [1921]; N.Y. Laws 1922, ch. 43 and N.J. Laws 1922, ch. 9, consented to by Congress 42
U.S. Stat. 822 [1922]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
